author: AFP
title: Cummins the hero as Australia beat Pakistan to win series
text: A fired-up Pat Cummins bagged five wickets and 10 in the match to earn Australia a nail-biting 79-run win in the second Test and clinch the series against a battling Pakistan Friday. Set 317 for victory, the visitors put up a stellar fight as they chased their first Test triumph in Australia since 1995. But they were dismissed for 237, with the last five wickets falling for 18 runs. Cummins was the chief destroyer, taking 5-49 to go with his first innings 5-48 — only the second 10-wicket haul of his Test career. Mitchell Starc chipped in with 4-55 as the tail collapsed after Shan Masood (60), Agha Salman (50) and Babar Azam (41) gave them a fighting chance. It was always going to be a tough task, with the highest-ever successful fourth innings run chase at the Melbourne Cricket Ground the 332-7 England managed in 1928, with no other team getting past 300. Opener Abdullah Shafique departed for four during a tricky session before lunch, caught by Usman Khawaja in the slips off Starc following a period of intense pressure. Iman-ul-Haq survived the initial blitz, but was no match after the break for Cummins, who sent down a probing ball that nipped back and trapped him lbw for 12. Masood was given out lbw by the umpire on 12, but it was overturned on review and he quickly got back in his stride. He took a nasty ball to the ribs that needed treatment, but was undeterred and raced to a gutsy 50 before Cummins again came to Australia’s rescue, enticing an edge to Steve Smith. There was plenty resting on the shoulders of Azam as the side’s premier batter and he looked in good nick. But after reaching 41, Josh Hazlewood got a ball to jag back and it clattered into his off stump. Mohammad Rizwan also looked dangerous on his way to 35 before Cummins again worked his magic, with Alex Carey collecting a catch behind the stumps after the ball went off the batsman’s glove. Cummins then removed Aamer Jamal and Shaheen Shah Afridi in quick succession before Starc cleaned up. Bounced back The Pakistanis padded up after the hosts were all out in their second innings for 262, after resuming on 187-6. Mir Hamza was the best of the bowlers with 4-32, while Afridi took 4-76. Carey slammed 53 to help Australia build their overnight lead and quieten chatter about his form after losing his place in the one-day side to Josh Inglis. He resumed on 16 after Australia had bounced back from 16-4 thanks to an attacking 96 from Mitchell Marsh and Smith’s gutsy 50. Carey, who made his first and only Test hundred in Melbourne a year ago, hit consecutive fours in his first over from Hasan Ali to build confidence. At the other end, Starc lived dangerously and fell for nine with the impressive Afridi getting the breakthrough on a pitch still offering a bit for the bowlers. Azam took the sharp chance at slip after Starc miscued a drive. Cummins made a breezy 16 but was caught behind by Rizwan off Jamal, while Lyon crunched two straight fours off Jamal, then was bowled for 11 three deliveries later. Carey brought up his sixth Test half-century before being the last man out, lbw to Hamza.

author: Newswatch Staff
title: Fire closes Highway 595 in Gillies area
text:
GILLIES TOWNSHIP — Firefighters from three rural fire services responded early Wednesday afternoon to a fire in Gillies Township that forced the closure of Highway 595.
The fire broke out on a property near Neva Road and created a large amount of smoke.
Sarah Shoemaker, chief of Nolalu Emergency Services, told Dougall Media "it appears there are hay bales in the field, and that's where it seems to be concentrated, but we don't know exactly what the cause of the fire is."
Shoemaker said no one was injured but a homeowner was assessed on the scene as a precaution.
The fire resulted in what she described as minor damage to outbuildings, a shed and some vehicles.
Multiple resources were deployed to the incident including 20 volunteer firefighters, two tankers, three rescue vehicles and two command trucks.
The cause of the fire remains under investigation.
With files from Emma Chilton/TBT News

author: FUNKE Mediengruppe
title: Siegen: Linke wollen Nazi-Nummernschilder aus dem Verkehr ziehen
text:
Siegen-Wittgenstein. Bestimmte Kfz-Kennzeichen mit Nazi-Bezug auf Kfz-Kennzeichen verboten. Linke: In Siegen-Wittgenstein sind noch andere mit eindeutiger Botschaft unterwegs.
Die Kreistagsfraktion der Linke möchte Nummernschilder, die einen Bezug zum „Dritten Reich“ der Nationalsozialisten aufweisen, aus dem Verkehr ziehen. In letzter Zeit seien vermehrt Autos mit „eindeutig rechtsextrem konnotierten Kennzeichen“ in Siegen-Wittgenstein gesichtet worden, so die Linke in ihrer Anfrage an Kreisverwaltung und Straßenverkehrsamt. Dabei handle es sich um konkrete Kombinationen aus Buchstaben und Zahlen, die in der Neonazi-Szene als Code genutzt werden, um ihre Gesinnung nach außen zu tragen - „33“ steht für das Jahr von Hitlers Machtergreifung, „HH“ für den Hitlergruß.
+++Mehr Nachrichten aus Siegen und dem Siegerland finden Sie hier!+++
Bestimmte Kombinationen, die bereits in der Nazizeit gängige Abkürzungen waren, sind ohnehin nicht erlaubt: HJ, NS, KZ, SA und SS. Rechtsextreme verwenden daher andere Kürzel, wie „AH“ (Hitlers Initialen), was natürlich nur in Kombination mit Zahlen „funktioniert“, die wiederum einen Bezug zum Nazi-Regime herstellen - die Jahreszahl 1945 zum Beispiel. Laut Linke-Kreistagsfraktionen seien in Siegen-Wittgenstein Kennzeichenkombinationen gesichtet worden, unter anderem „HH 33“, „AH 18“ „SI EG 1945“ oder „SI EG 88“. Solche Kombinationen mit Bezug zum Nationalsozialismus seien zunächst möglich, könnten aber von der zuständigen Kommune untersagt werden. Demnach würden einige Landkreise bereits solche Buchstaben-Zahlen-Kombinationen auf Nummernschildern verbieten.
+++Die Lokalredaktion Siegen ist auch bei Facebook!+++
Die Linke will nun von der Zulassungsbehörde des Kreises wissen, warum sie „solche verfassungswidrigen Kennzeichen ausstellt bzw. in der Vergangenheit ausgestellt hat?“, welche internen Vorgaben es zum Umgang mit solchen Nummernschildern gibt und wie viele solcher Kennzeichen in den vergangenen Jahren ausgestellt wurden. „Wir fordern hiermit den Kreis Siegen-Wittgenstein dazu auf, die entsprechenden Kennzeichen zu kontrollieren und diese abzuändern“, heißt es weiter. Das Straßenverkehrsamt solle in Zukunft verstärkt auf solche Zusammenhänge achten und durch entsprechende Verbote ein deutliches Zeichen gegen faschistische und rechtsextremistische Tendenzen und Gesinnungen auch in Siegen-Wittgenstein setzen.

author: AIM
title: Incendio consume palapa frente a oficinas de la Conanp en Tizimín
text:
RÍO LAGARTOS.- Un incendio forestal en un rancho ubicado frente a las oficinas de la Comisión Nacional de Áreas Naturales Protegidas (Conanp) alcanzó el área de usos múltiples consumiendo todo el techo de huano.
De acuerdo con la información recabada, los fuertes vientos que se registraban alrededor de las 3 de la tarde habrían provocado que una chispa alcanzara el techo, el cual fue consumido por el fuego en cuestión de minutos.
Bomberos acudieron al lugar del siniestro
Los bomberos de la Secretaría de Seguridad Pública (SSP) con base en Tizimín, se movilizaron al lugar, pero por la distancia de 50 kilómetros que separan la estación del siniestro, no pudieron salvar la construcción.
Hasta el momento se desconocen los daños en el interior del inmueble y los cuerpos de emergencia continúan trabajando en el lugar para evitar que el fuego se propague hacia la población.
TE PUEDE INTERESAR: Fiscalía de Yucatán realizó primera audiencia pública en Tizimín
Las oficinas federales siniestradas se ubican exactamente en el entronque de la carretera hacia Las Coloradas y a San Felipe.
Llamado a prevenir incendios en Yucatán
Cada año, en estas épocas de intenso calor, las autoridades de Protección Civil llaman a la población yucateca a prevenir incendios forestales en la temporada de calor.
Entre otras cosas, piden no quemar basura al aire libre y no arrojar cigarros encendidos ni objetos de vidrio a la vera de las carreteras.
También piden a productores que en la temporada en que realizan quemas agrícolas notifiquen a la autoridad municipal sobre la quema que realizarán para que se lleve al cabo de manera controlada, tal como disponen los procedimientos oficiales de la Secretaría de Desarrollo Rural del Estado.
¿Dónde reportar incendios forestales?
Asimismo, llaman a reportar cualquier incendio que detecten al número gratuito de emergencias 911, a fin de atender el control y sofocación del fuego y de esa manera contribuir a la protección de los bienes y las personas.
Por su parte, las autoridades federales piden a la población a que en caso de detectar un incendio forestal lo reporte al 800 INCENDIO (800 42236346).
Con información de Isauro Chi Díaz

author: Daniel Yanofsky
title: Jason Aldean 2025 tickets: Best prices, cities, dates for 'Full Throttle' Tour with Nate Smith and more - NewsBreak
text:
By Daniel Yanofsky ,
1 hours ago
Jason Aldean has become quite a force in the music industry. The country music singer is ready to take his talents on the road in 2025 when he starts the "Full Throttle" North American tour.
Aldean signed a massive record deal with Broken Bow Records in 2005, and his first album, titled his name, made it to the top ten on the Billboard country charts. Since then, he has earned platinum status on several albums, including "Night Train," "Wide Open," and "Old Boots, New Dirt."
The 47-year-old has been nominated for five Grammy Awards and has won multiple CMA and ACM Awards. He reached superstardom when "Try That In A Small Town" reached the top of the Billboard Hot 100, a song that has gained notoriety amidst its controversy. Regardless, his dedicated fans go crazy for every strum of his guitar.
Aldean will be joined on the tour by Nate Smith, RaeLynn, and Dee Jay Silver and will co-headline an event with Brooks & Dunn. It leads to an upcoming album he believes will be well-received.
BUY NOW: Jason Aldean tickets for every 2025 show
"We got a new one on the album, it's just a powerful type of song that people are going to relate to, and it has nothing to do with politics or any of those things," Aldean said via Hook & Barrel .
The Sporting News has everything you need to know to grab tickets to one of Jason Aldean's upcoming shows.
Jason Aldean tickets for 2025 'Full Throttle' Tour StubHub Tickets for Jason Aldean's "Full Throttle" Tour are already available on StubHub.
The first show, at Ohio's Blossom Music Center on May 23, has ticket prices starting at $38 , with prices reaching $3,449. A May 30 show at Fenway Park has tickets starting at $56 .
A July 17 show at the BOK Center in Oklahoma has tickets starting at $46 , with prices reaching $8,972. Meanwhile, a September 25 show at the Cajundome has ticket prices starting at $48 , with prices reaching $8,972.
Jason Aldean 'Full Throttle' Tour 2025 cities, dates The "Full Throttle" tour begins in Ohio on May 23. Following an event in Boston, Jason Aldean heads to the Tailgate N' Tallboys on June 7.
Through the summer, Aldean will visit Oklahoma, Arkansas, Missouri, New Mexico, Colorado, and more. He heads to Canada for part of the tour, with an appearance at Big Valley Jamboree on August 3.
Aldean goes to the Cajundome September 25 and ends his tour in October with two events in Florida.
Below is a complete schedule of cities and dates for the "Full Throttle" tour. You can see the cheapest seats available for every date right here .

author: 自由時報電子報
title: 畢業季、轉職潮 台南永康徵才釋出2000職缺
text:
畢業季、轉職潮 台南永康徵才釋出2000職缺
永康就業中心將於14日上午於南大附中舉辦現場徵才活動，計有34家企業、釋出近2000個工作機會。（圖由永康就業中心提供）
〔記者劉婉君／台南報導〕畢業季與轉職潮，勞動部勞動力發展署雲嘉南分署永康就業中心將於14日上午9時至12時，於國立台南大學附屬高級中學活動中心，舉辦年度規模最大的現場徵才活動，將有34家企業、釋出近2000個工作機會，力拚青年與婦女順利接軌職場。
參與的企業橫跨科技、製造、餐飲、服務與零售等，包括統一實業、志鋼金屬、緯穎智造、王品餐飲等指標品牌。釋出的職缺中有7成薪資32K以上，3成達40K以上，還有研發工程師職缺提供月薪100K的高薪條件。
請繼續往下閱讀...
永康就業中心主任李奇玫表示，此次釋出的近2000個職缺中，有約4成不需工作經驗，非常適合初次尋職的青年或轉換跑道的民眾。職缺類型包括產品製程工程師、設備技術員、財務助理、行政人員、門市銷售與作業員等。
因應大專畢業生的就業需求，現場將首度設置「青年尋職冒險館」主題專區。李奇玫說，台南市每年有超過2萬5000位大專院校畢業生進入就業市場，許多青年初次面對職場，容易徬徨迷惘，因此，青年專區將提供履歷健檢、模擬面試、職涯諮詢等多元服務，協助青年釐清方向；另外還有「青年服務台」，由專人說明政府各項就業補助與資源，協助青年充分掌握職涯資訊。
此外，為了協助婦女重返職場，現場也新增「親子友善諮詢區」與「二度就業婦女專區」，提供托育陪同照護服務，幫助有幼童的婦女可以安心求職。活動並規劃再就業說明會、職涯引導與彈性工作推介，協助家庭照顧者順利重啟職涯。針對符合條件的婦女，也心將說明勞動部提供的就業獎勵金政策，符合資格者最高可申請3萬元獎勵金，減輕重新投入職場的經濟負擔。
同場也安排職訓成果展示、手作DIY互動體驗，以及限量早鳥禮與線上問卷禮等。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: Michael Angelo B. Asis
title: March Madness: Can Cooper Flagg Win It All?  | The Manila Times
text:
It's the most exciting month in all of basketball. We have the homestretch of the NBA regular season, and the main reason why the next four weeks will be crazy fun for hoops fans, the NCAA Division 1 Tournament, otherwise known as March Madness.
From 352 Division 1 teams, they chose 68, which will whittle down to 64 on the first day. Then, the madness begins with the single-game elimination, "win or go home" format. From the two opening rounds, to the Sweet Sixteen, the Elite Eight, the Final Four, and the National Championship.
Just before the regular season ended, the Duke Blue Devils won the ACC tournament, and wrested the no.1 ranking from Auburn University. The Auburn Tigers lost in the SEC semifinal, while Duke took care of business and beat Louisville. For most of the season, Auburn was at no.1, and Duke lingered at the second and third spots due to early losses to Kentucky and Kansas. Since then, they only lost once the rest of the way, to the Clemson Tigers.
With or Without the Flagg

author: kentlivenewsdesk@reachplc.com (Kieran Graves)
title: Kent weather: Met Office issues 16-hour wind warning for New Year weekend with 75mph gusts
text: The Met Office has issued a 16-hour yellow weather warning for wind across Kent and the south of England for the New Year weekend with gusts of 50mph widely forecast and speeds of up to 75mph in some southern coastal areas. The alert comes into force from 11am (December 30) and means “strong and gusty” winds are expected until 3am on Sunday (December 31). The alert covers the whole of the county as a strong spell of wind moves east across England and Wales. The forecaster has warned of travel disruption and possible short-term losses of power or services. It said some delays are likely on road, rail, air, and ferry transport and that journeys on buses and trains will “probably” take longer. “Delays for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges likely,” The Met Office continued. Read more: [Man who lives in his Ford Fiesta spends ‘perfect Christmas’ alone in Kent woods](https://www.kentlive.news/news/real-life/man-who-lives-ford-fiesta-9001236) Read more: [Historic bar visited by Ed Sheeran closes 'with immediate effect'](https://www.kentlive.news/whats-on/food-drink/historic-bar-visited-ed-sheeran-9001737) “It’s likely that some coastal routes, sea fronts, and coastal communities will be affected by spray and/or large waves. Some short-term loss of power and other services is possible.” Gusts of 45 to 50 mph are widely forecast but conditions will be squally near the cold front bringing the weather and gusts may hit 60mph. Stronger gusts of up to 75mph are “likely near coasts in the west and south”. Drivers and those looking to travel have been advised to check conditions and timetables before they leave to avoid delays. Those on or visiting coastal areas have been urged to stay safe by being aware of large waves.
